subject: Sleep
title: Freud and Dream Interpretation
description: A fast breakdown of Freud and Dream Interpretation for builders.

hook.text: In 1899, Sigmund Freud published a book claiming every dream is a disguised wish fulfillment. It changed everything.

buildup.text: Freud argued dreams have manifest content, the surface story, and latent content, the hidden meaning.

discovery.text: He believed the unconscious used symbols to smuggle forbidden wishes past a mental censor into dreams.

twist.text: Modern neuroscience has largely debunked Freud's specific theories. Dreams don't work as wish disguisers.

climax.text: But Freud's core insight remains influential: dreams reveal something about the dreamer's emotional life.

punchline.text: Freud was wrong about the details but right about the idea.

quiz.question: What has modern science concluded about Freud's dream theory?
options: The specific mechanisms are debunked but the emotional insight endures
